description: This comforting baked oatmeal combines wholesome oats, warm cinnamon, and sweet dried cranberries for a hearty breakfast treat. Easy to prepare and perfect for cozy mornings, it’s a beloved recipe from Pennsylvania Amish country that everyone will enjoy.
ingredients: 1 cup brown sugar, or to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a large bowl, mix together oats, brown sugar, cinnamon, baking powder, and salt.
Beat in eggs, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract until well combined.
Spread the mixture evenly into a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until the top is golden and set, about 40 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.
Serve warm, topped with milk if desired.
tips: For best results, use rolled oats rather than instant or steel-cut oats to achieve the perfect texture. Avoid overbaking to keep the oatmeal moist and tender. Feel free to swap dried cranberries with other dried fruits like blueberries or fresh diced apples for seasonal variations.

structured_content.content: This baked oatmeal recipe is a warm, inviting breakfast that fills your kitchen with the cozy aroma of cinnamon and vanilla. The tender oats combined with sweet dried cranberries create a comforting texture and flavor that’s perfect for chilly mornings or anytime you crave a wholesome start.

structured_content.content: This recipe has been a cherished staple in Pennsylvania Amish country for generations, bringing families together around the breakfast table. I remember waking up to the smell of baked oatmeal filling the house, a simple yet heartwarming start to the day.

• Main ingredient: Rolled oats provide the perfect chewy texture and absorb the flavors beautifully; avoid instant oats for best results.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Ground cinnamon adds warmth, while vanilla extract enhances sweetness and depth.
  • Supporting ingredients: Brown sugar balances tartness from dried cranberries and adds caramel notes; baking powder helps the oatmeal rise slightly for a tender crumb.
  • Equipment needed: Large mixing bowl, 9x13-inch baking dish, whisk or spoon for mixing, oven.

Preparation:
Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Gather and measure all ingredients to streamline the process.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Combine dry ingredients thoroughly to ensure even flavor distribution. Beat eggs and mix with milk, melted butter, and vanilla, then combine with dry mix. Stir in dried cranberries last. Spread the batter evenly in the baking dish and bake until golden and set, about 40 minutes. Look for a lightly browned top and a firm center.
Finishing Touches:
Allow the baked oatmeal to cool slightly before serving to let it set. Serve warm, optionally topped with a splash of milk for extra creaminess.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Use rolled oats for the best texture; instant oats will become mushy.
  • Don’t overbake to avoid dryness—look for a golden top and firm but moist center.
  • The baked oatmeal is ready when a toothpick inserted comes out clean or with moist crumbs.
  • Store leftovers covered in the refrigerator for up to 4 days; reheat gently with a splash of milk.

structured_content.content: Sharing this baked oatmeal with family on crisp fall mornings has become a beloved tradition, evoking warmth and togetherness. It’s a dish that comforts and nourishes, making every bite feel like a cozy hug.

Elevate this baked oatmeal by adding a pinch of nutmeg or ground ginger for extra warmth. Swap dried cranberries for chopped nuts or fresh seasonal fruits like apples or pears. Drizzle with maple syrup or honey before serving for a natural sweetness boost.

Serve alongside fresh fruit or a dollop of yogurt for added creaminess. Pair with hot coffee, tea, or a glass of fresh orange juice for a balanced breakfast. Perfect for cozy weekend brunches or holiday mornings with loved ones.

For a gluten-free version, use certified gluten-free oats. Vegan adaptations can be made by substituting eggs with flax eggs and using plant-based milk and butter alternatives. Try adding shredded zucchini or carrots for a subtle veggie boost while maintaining sweetness.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Whisk eggs and liquids thoroughly before combining with dry ingredients for even texture.
  • Use melted butter at room temperature to blend smoothly without clumps.
  • Check doneness starting at 35 minutes to prevent overbaking.
  • Serve in the baking dish for a rustic presentation or cut into neat squares for a polished look.
